heading: schwab online breaks down
subheading: the brokerage's online trading system shut down for about an hour wednesday morning because of mainframe problems.
author: wired news report
text: the online trading system at charles schwab broke down for about an hour wednesday morning because of mainframe computer problems, the brokerage said. the system went down at about 6:30 a.m, san francisco time, and was repaired around 7:30 a.m., said schwab (sch) spokesman dan hubbard. in the meantime, the company told customers to use its telephone trading and automated telebroker system, which processes stock trades entered with a touch-tone phone.the breakdown took place shortly after the opening of the new york stock exchange and nasdaq markets, typically one of the busiest trading times of the day."our site does experience quite heavy volume and it's certainly possible that we inconvenienced some of our customers, and for that we are sorry," hubbard said.breakdowns of online trading systems have come under increasing scrutiny as more people use their pcs to invest. three weeks ago, etrade experienced three days of sporadic breakdowns, enraging thousands of customers.
